image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone in their hand, with a sports betting app open on the phone.

props.synopsis: For years, Australia’s de facto online gambling regulator has been based in the Northern Territory. Advocates say that’s a problem and are urging the next federal government to take action.

title.children: How six people in the NT regulate Australia's online gambling trade

image.altText: Willie Rioli celebrates

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide forward Willie Rioli missed club training on Tuesday morning in the wake of the furore around his social media post about Hawthorn.

title.children: Rioli granted day off as club supports forward following social media post

image.altText: A woman and a man standing outside of a home near a fence.

props.synopsis: Home ownership rates in Australia have been falling for decades, and with rental vacancies at record lows and prices at historic highs, many fear their dream of owning a home may be out of reach. Some experts say rental caps could help.

title.children: Australia's growing cohort of tenants fear they will rent forever

image.altText: A drone photo of a small ramp, with clear seas and lush greenery. The sky is blue.

props.synopsis: Marion Scrymgour has revealed the Northern Territory government and Commonwealth are a "long way" from resolving a funding dispute over the controversial Middle Arm industrial precinct outside of Darwin.

title.children: Federal MP casts doubt over future of billion-dollar Middle Arm project

image.altText: White cattle on red dirt stares at the camera with blue sky and low dry shrub in the background.

props.synopsis: Northern Australia's cattle industry is once again battling the government at the Federal Court, seeking compensation that reflects its losses from the export ban.

title.children: Cattle industry back in court chasing final payout for live export ban

image.altText: A drone photo overlooking the Tanami mine, you can see a big pit with infrastructure in the background.

props.synopsis: One of the country's most remote mines is getting a billion-dollar upgrade, taking gold production deeper into the Tanami Desert as gold prices hit record highs.

title.children: Australia's remote desert mine plans for 40 more golden years

image.altText: A designed image showing a man with a moustache and beard on top of a yellow background showing a map of the seat of Reid.

props.synopsis: Clive Palmer's Trumpet of Patriots party has endorsed a candidate to run in a battleground electorate who has been prohibited from providing health services as he "posed a risk to the health and safety of the public".

title.children: Trumpet of Patriots candidate bought PhD online

image.altText: A cardboard box with survival products in it. A person's hand is reaching into the box.

props.synopsis: With war on their doorstep, Europeans have been warned to prepare survival kits with enough essentials to last them 72 hours, and Britain's leading disaster expert says the idea has been borrowed from Australia.

title.children: Europeans told to gather supplies for 72 hours amid 'direct' war threat

image.altText: A graphic of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton cut-outs

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton both begin their day in Melbourne, ahead of tonight's ABC-hosted election leaders debate in Parramatta. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese and Dutton both begin in Melbourne before ABC's leader debate

image.altText: Luke Smith wearing a suit, smiling with his arms crossed while standing in Logan's council chambers.

props.synopsis: "Bitch with the glasses" and "Well f***en get on the team, bitch" were among comments picked up by corruption investigators probing Logan City Council, according to the court documents.

title.children: Crooked mayor's conversations caught on secret phone taps, court documents show

image.altText: The back of a woman's head looking out a window into a garden

props.synopsis: Victorian senate candidate Jordan van den Lamb says he will consider an apology to a Victorian woman whose vacant property was occupied by squatters after he published the address online.

title.children: 'I'm not rich': Break-in victim calls out senate candidate's squatting campaign

image.altText: A military plane on a runway.

props.synopsis: Moscow's relationship with Jakarta is in the spotlight, after a report claimed the Kremlin had asked to station war planes at an air base 1,200 kilometres from Darwin.

title.children: Russia 'working quietly' on Indonesia military ties before air base storm

image.altText: A man in a dark blue suit stands at the top of stairs leading to an airplane smiling and waiving at the camera

props.synopsis: Chinese President Xi Jinping has landed in Malaysia after visiting Vietnam, as he tries to secure more support from South-East Asian neighbours amid the trade war with Donald Trump.

title.children: China 'tearing down walls' as it looks to boost trade ties in Asia

image.altText: Actress Cate Blanchett standing on the red carpet smiling

props.synopsis: The Australian-born Oscar-winning actress says there were many things she wanted to do with her life following the release of her latest major spy film, Black Bag.

title.children: Cate Blanchett 'serious' about giving up acting

image.altText: A weather map showing a cyclone off the coast of WA, north-west of Broome.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Errol has formed in waters off the northern Kimberley coast and is expected to become a category three system by Thursday morning.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Errol forms, predicted to become category three system

image.altText: A man in a black blazer sits before a microphone

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea's foreign minister says he personally hopes Labor wins the Australian election, stating the incumbent government had done "a tremendous job" of rebuilding relationships in the Pacific.

title.children: 'This is personal': Pacific foreign minister wants Labor election win

image.altText: A screen on the dash of an electric vehicle showing how much power the battery has.

props.synopsis: A push to get EV chargers installed on Queensland's Capricorn Coast has been suspended following the broadcast of a report on "dirty nickel".

title.children: EV charger plan suspended after mayor watches commercial media report

image.altText: Demonstrators rally holding signs that say hands off Harvard

props.synopsis: The funding freeze comes after the institution said it would reject the Trump administration's demands to change hiring, admissions and other policies.

title.children: Harvard hit with $US2.2 billion funding freeze after defying Trump's demands

image.altText: woman with grey hair wearing large beads and a dark blue dress with black curtain behind her

props.synopsis: The ABC's inaugural Elder-in-residence, Professor Jackie Huggins, has come full circle after beginning at the broadcaster as a teenager and will now help lead responses to the Listen Loudly, Act Strongly report into racism.

title.children: The ABC's first Elder-in-residence wants to see a future without racism

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton shake hands at an election leaders' debate

props.synopsis: Today's debate between the prime minister and the opposition leader will be broadcast by the ABC.

title.children: How to watch the second debate between Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton

image.altText: a young man wearing hi-vis and a hard hat next to his dad wearing the same

props.synopsis: Harry Dutton joined his father for a second press opportunity on Tuesday, the prime minister said Tanya Plibersek would get a "senior" cabinet job if Labor was re-elected and an MP has compared his peer to a dog.

title.children: There's a universal rule on politics and kids  — and this week Dutton broke it

image.altText: David Lee in black glasses and blue shirt on a suburban street with grass and houses

props.synopsis: While cost of living and housing are important issues to those in Greater Western Sydney, a key detail major parties will also need to address are the adverse effects of the region’s rapid population growth.

title.children: Problems related to Greater Western Sydney’s growth another key focus this election

image.altText: A farmer stands on a piece of rusted machinery in the middle of a farm

props.synopsis: Despite applying for government drought funding months ago, one South Australian farmer says he is still waiting for assistance.

title.children: Farmer waits on drought relief payments for months

image.altText: Ava and Deborah, dressed up, press their faces together in a photoshoot in Hacks.

props.synopsis: Hacks stars Jean Smart and Hannah Einbinder talk comedy's power to platform women in Hollywood beyond their looks, in a new series its creators call the "most autobiographical" yet.

title.children: 'Comedy is a protective measure': Hacks stars talk making TV under Trump

image.altText: A close-up of Volodomyr Zelenskyy in front of a Ukrainian flag.

props.synopsis: The US president said the Ukrainian leader should share blame with Vladimir Putin for the war and the "millions of people dead".

title.children: Trump blames Zelenskyy for Ukraine war in wake of Russian missile attack

image.altText: Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii holds the ball in two hands against the Chiefs.

props.synopsis: It may still be three months out from the British and Irish Lions series, but Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii is giving Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt reason to consider his options at the selection table.

title.children: Suaalii is creating a Wallabies selection headache ahead of Lions Tests

image.altText: President Putin and President Prabowo seated on ornate golden chairs facing each other at a meeting in Moscow.

props.synopsis: Indonesia has denied it will allow any Russian long-range aircraft at its air force base after reports send Canberra scrambling.

title.children: Canberra confirms no Russian planes to be stationed in Indonesian air base

image.altText: Patrick Voss swings an arm into the face of Nick Vlaustin, who is running with the ball

props.synopsis: Patrick Voss will serve a three-game ban for striking Richmond's Nick Vlaustin, with Fremantle unsuccessful in trying to downgrade his penalty to a two-game suspension.

title.children: Docker Voss fails to reduce ban for strike that left Tiger with broken nose

image.altText: A flood approaches a small outback town surrounded by a levy

props.synopsis: Emergency services say road closures around the remote South Australian town of Innamincka are likely to be in place for months, prompting concern about the local tourism industry.

title.children: As floodwaters recede, Innamincka locals face long wait for roads to re-open

image.altText: A bald man wearing a white t-shirt speaking to reporters, with an angry expression and one finger raised in the air

props.synopsis: Papers filed last week accuse the online influencer, a self-described misogynist, of rape and sexual assault, and of pointing a gun at a woman's face.

title.children: Andrew Tate to face UK civil trial over rape and coercive control claims

image.altText: Jordan looking at a real estate sign out front of a house.

props.synopsis: With home ownership more out of reach than ever for younger Australians, some are pondering whether their retirement fund would be better off used now, to buy a house.

title.children: Is a home deposit now worth thousands in lost super at retirement?

image.altText: A man's left hand holds a glass that's being filled with drinking water in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: A class action against Sydney Water over PFAS is looming as mystery surrounds the sudden departure of a former executive.

title.children: A missing former boss, a looming class action and forever chemicals in water

image.altText: A power station surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: Treasurer and Energy Minister David Janetzki failed to mention the incident in a major address a week ago, despite being briefed about the incident the day it happened.

title.children: Opposition accuses government of 'covering up' power plant explosion

image.altText: A man with glasses in suit smiling while waving his right hand

props.synopsis: This vote, which will be held on May 3, will be Lawrence Wong's first electoral test after he succeeded long-standing premier Lee Hsien Loong as leader of the People's Action Party last May.

title.children: Singapore dissolves parliament ahead of general election

image.altText: The Star, formally known as Star City Casino, Sydney.

props.synopsis: Casino firm Star Entertainment pulled back from the brink of collapse thanks to a deal with US giant Bally's and pub billionaire Bruce Mathieson. Now its shares are set to return to trade, after it posted a steeper-than-expected financial fall.

title.children: Star posts $300m loss as it attempts turnaround
